page.title: 04MILTON AREA UNEMPLOYMENT.
page.content: Industry near Milton has changed.Farms were mechanised,mills closed and 'Big Hooses'like Balfour House,providers of many jobs,employed fewer workers. Our block became a{coal mining}area,but paper and whisky industries provided jobs.By 1967 only 2 big pits existed, on the River Forth.One closed in 1984 and the other is now smaller.Linoleum factories in Kirkcaldy and engineering firms in Leven shut down.Haig(whisky) Markinch closed in 1983.{Unemployment} is now very high.People{travel}to work at various jobs_firms like Cameron distillery(1822),Cameron Hospital-1911 and paper mills in Glenrothes(oldest 1806),but Kirkcaldy District and Fife Regional Councils are the largest employers.Electronic and other factories in Glenrothes,the oil jacket yard at Methil and the new whisky bottling plant at Leven provide jobs.
